DrD

I cannot believe how dumb we have become when considering leaders of this country. If McCain had not have pulled Palin from the frozen tundra to be his VP, she would still be a nobody. And yet, because he, in his infinite wisdom, chose her (God only knows why) she is the greatest thing since slliced bread on the political scene. Afterall, she was mayor of a city of 6000 and governor of a state of 700,000 and can see Russia from her.
 
 Following the last 8 years, how we could consider repeating this scenario is beyond belief! The dems and the repubs have a platform and basic issues for which they stand. How does calling someone a MAVRICK make them different from the party they represent? It doesn't! Apparently we are subject to any superficiality which appears so long as it "represents" the way we think. If the repubs hadn't come up with a "term" to describe their next candidate, like say MAVERICK, he would be called a republican. . . .a label everyone wants to forget this election. Wonder why? Why can't anyone see that the term MAVERICK is no more than a label to hide the real candidate. . .a republican. This is nothing more than a gimmick to distract voters, get votes and some people simply refuse to acknowledge the trick.
 
 How do we do get new leadership by electing the same thought process who put us in this mess? 
 
 I guess calling someone a "MAVRICK " makes it so. r i g h t. You can call a political candidate a maverick but at the end of the day he is still a republican. Who would have thunk it?
 
 And we talk about "lipstick on a pig" as if that is a serious gaff. We have greater problems in this country than acting like children and saying, "See what you said. . .I'm gonna tell". How childish can we get? How dumb can we get? How much denial can we use? Guess we'll see.

post_info.post_title: They are not qualified to fix anything.  Here's why.

T.Q

 emoticon_xhoho Bravo
Symbiote
Neither party will serve your interests, get over the childish idea that one party is better than the other.
isly ilwott

And yet, because he, in his infinite wisdom, chose her (God only knows why) she is the greatest thing since slliced bread on the political scene. Afterall, she was mayor of a city of 6000 and governor of a state of 700,000 and can see Russia from her.

Apparently we are subject to any superficiality which appears so long as it "represents" the way we think.  There's a bell shaped curve for every issue. While I agree with the sillyness of the attention given to Obama's 'lipstick on a pig' characterization of the McCain plan (it had nothing to do with Sarah Palin), I do not agree that McCain is not different. I don't see his plan as '4 more years of the same' based on what GWB has done. I see his plan as an improvement on a plan that jumped the tracks long ago and was not properly set back on them. I see his plan as infinitely better than the socialism and growth-killing that will follow Obama's initiative. I think he's called a Maverick because he will not consistently eat at the boss's feed trough and he often disagrees with the head Republicans. On the bell shaped curve for Republicans, he's as distinct as Zell Miller and Joe Lieberman were on the Democrat's curve.
 
 
Neither party will serve your interests, get over the childish idea that one party is better than the other.
The part ahead of the comma is incorrect, the part after is dead on. There's not a dime's worth of difference between the Republicans and the Democrats. It's the mavericks along the bell shaped curve of each party that are worth listening to. Both Zell and Joe on the Democratic side differed with their hardliners enough to gain my admiration. Joe Lieberman would likely have made a good choice back when we were offered John Kerry. John McCain is a good choice when we are offered alternatives like Obama and Hillary. I would not care who he chose as a running mate. I am pleased that he has chosen someone willing to reform government and get rid of the Lear Jets and expensive perks for government workers.
 
 It will serve my interests better for the government to stay out of administering health care. It will serve my interests better for the government to let me decide what to do with my income rather than overtax me and spend my money as the twerps and crooks within the government ranks would so inefficiently do.
 
 Change is what we need, but not a change toward socialism, higher taxes and more government services.
 
 That appears to be the most important issue to me. Government overspending for the Democrats involves hiring more government employees to create more government agencies to oversee the government giveaway programs established to give the people what the government thinks the people need. Government overspending for the Republicans involves spending more money in the private sector. Overspending by either party is not what we need. We need a balanced budget. We need to put a stop to graft and wasteful spending. We need to get rid of taxes on income and begin taxing consumption. (People with illegal incomes would begin to pay taxes.)
 
 We certainly do not need to follow the aspirations of a Marxist such as Barrack Hussein Obama.
chester

Change is what we need, but not a change toward socialism, higher taxes and more government services.

 
 Guess what, GWB has already brought us socialism.
 
 Thanks to the bailouts, the people own the banks, the brokerage houses, the mortgage market guarantors, the insurance companies, etc.
 
 Who's going to pay the tab? Your and my kids, grandkids, and their kids.
 
 Right before your very eyes, isly, the Repugs have engineered the greatest expansion of government power since the New Deal - and McStain agrees with all of it.
 
 Who are the stealth socialists in this country? None other than the Republican Party.
 
 Please, PLEASE, no more bleating about anyone other than the so-called free marketers in the Republican Party.emoticon_mad
DrD

Nice way to put it. small government is a good montra and a lot of people buy it. Mr. McCain was hailed the hero for de-regulation for years.... and now he supports the bailout 100%. Funny how that works. Oh that's right. . .in this country we can have it both ways. . . .if you're a mavrick! Like originally put, no one wants to mention "republican". Such a bad word. But Maverick is okay. It takes the sting out of the idea he's still a republican. Here's a hint. . .He is the candidate for president ON THE REPUBLICAN TICKET. 
 I thought that a maverick would be more like an independent. . . . . .
isly ilwott

Regardless of the cause of a financial meltdown, the governement...whether controlled by Democrats or Republicans...is correct in bailing it out in order to avoid a total collapse. Other nations do the same. Whether you want to call it socialism depends on how you see it and the purpose of your argument.
 
 The root cause of the housing debacle can be laid upon Jimmy Carter and Bill Clinton. The social program of making home loans available to people that could not afford them is a Democratic program from day one. Giveaway programs eventually come back to cost the government more than the value of what was given away.
 
 I think we had no reasonable choice other than to bail out the big firms whose collapse would have snowballed into a complete shutdown of the economy and a depression to top all we've seen to date.
 
 One should remember that our history is that each administration had to deal with problems that were germinated years prior.
DrD

The social program of making home loans available to people that could not afford them is a Democratic program from day one. Giveaway programs eventually come back to cost the government more than the value of what was given away.

 Yea, let's forget about the present war started without cause based on lies costing us billions a month, ($4000 a second) let's forget about the non-regulated present greed which has destroyed the economy, let's fget about the present predatory lenders making bad housing loans, let's just forget about the present administration. Let's forget about the last 8 years, period. It hasn't been there fault at all.
 
 It's the democrats fault. . . . .That damn Carter and Clinton.emoticon_xkill I forgot, my bad.
isly ilwott

Let's forget about the last 8 years, period. It hasn't been there fault at all.

I didn't exclude the present admin from some contribution to the overall financial mess. However, it is extremely unfair to just blame everything on the present admin just because they're in office when the bubble breaks.
 
 One should be able to understand that a social program designed to enable unqualified borrowers to take on mortage debt is bound to collapse. Jimmy and Billy enabled that.
simone

 No! Not Carter and Clinton!
 
 Predatory lending practices. Desperate American workers who do not earn living wages who are trying to meet their bills, put gas in their vehicles so they can get to work, people who are desperate to put food on the table. These people are lured into losing their home equity by "no interest loans" because conservatives have destroyed American education so much that Americans are no longer knowledgeable about finance, expecially individual finance.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  They are not qualified to fix anything.  Here's why.
